thread.title: Ravens' Terrence Brooks has surgical procedure to repair left thumb | Football
thread.title_full: Ravens' Terrence Brooks has surgical procedure to repair left thumb | Football | ArcaMax Publishing

author: arcamax.com
title: Ravens' Terrence Brooks has surgical procedure to repair left thumb | Football
text:
Ravens second-year safety Terrence Brooks acknowledged Thursday that he had a recent surgical procedure to repair damage to his left thumb.
Brooks, who was hurt late in an Oct. 11 loss to the Cleveland Browns, did not play in last week's game against the San Francisco 49ers and appears unlikely to play Monday against the Arizona Cardinals, further thinning the Ravens' safety depth. Starting safety Kendrick Lewis is also dealing with a bruised knee.
"It was a little worse than I thought," said Brooks who had his hand in a cast and heavily wrapped as he watched practice. "1/8Doctors3/8 went in and did a few things to it. ... It's something that's taken care of right now. I'm just really on the recovery process now, trying to not really think about what happened back at the last game. For the most part, we're recovering really well, and I should be back soon."
Brooks didn't reveal the extent of the damage to his thumb, and he also declined to speculate on when he may return, although he said that the outlook is "pretty good."
"This, the thumb thing, is not really a big deal," Brooks said. "I hate missing time and being away from my brothers but I had knee surgery 1/8last year3/8. This is nothing compared to that. Really, I just keep on adapting to whatever happens. I'm just hopeful for no more injuries."
